reference.title: CPUPWRCTLR_EL1, Power Control Register, EL1
reference.shortdesc: The CPUPWRCTLR_EL1 provides information about power control support for the core.

section.title: Bit field descriptions
section.p: CPUPWRCTLR_EL1 is a 32-bit register, and is part of the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED registers functional group.

dlentry.dd: Disable the retention circuit. This is the default value, see Table 1 for more retention control options.
Disable the retention circuit. This is the default value, see Table 1 for more retention control options.

dd.p: Indicates to the power controller using PACTIVE if the core wants to power down when it enters WFI state.

dlentry.dd: No power down requested. This is the reset value.

row.entry: Number of counter ticksThe number of system counter ticks required before the signals retention readiness on CTIVE to the power controller. The does not accept a retention entry request until this time.

section.title: Usage constraints

dd.p: This register can be using MRS with the following syntax:
This register can be written using MSR with the following syntax:

section.p: This syntax is encoded with the following settings in the instruction encoding:

dd.p: This register is accessible in software as follows:

section.p: 'n/a' Not accessible. The PE cannot be executing at this Exception level, so this access is not possible.

dd.p: For a description of the prioritization of any generated exceptions, see Synchronous prioritization in the Arm Architecture Reference Manual Armv8, for Armv8-A architecture profile for s taken to AArch64 state.
Write access to this register from EL1 or EL2 depends on the value of bit[7] of ACTLR_EL2 and ACTLR_EL3.
